intro: Mesembryanthemum parvum, commonly known as the narrowleaf iceplant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its succulent leaves and flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its small, clustered flowers are usually pink or white, and it blooms during the cooler months. Mesembryanthemum parvum is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
